answers.answer: Yes, stress causes the release of hormones that block the effectiveness of insulin, so stress certainly could be a factor in your problem with the control of your glucose. Maybe you should discuss ways to alleviate stress with your doctor.

question: I am 74 years old.   I  have diabetes 2.  My blood sugar has gone over 500 for the past month.  I watch my diet very closely.  However I have been under a lot of stress, and depression.  Can this cause Blood Sugar to rise.  My oral meds, and insulin have  not been successful in bringing  my Blood Sugar below 210.  I was in the hospital for two days, and every test came back negative.  I have been having bad dizzy spells, and they gave me a cat Scan, MRI, EKG, and artery scan.Can you give me any information about what may be happening to cause the increase?
title: Stress and High Blood Sugar
